revised_title: Isometric Motion of a Charged Fluid in the Einstein-Maxwell Theory
tldr: The article explores the isometric motion of a charged fluid in the Einstein-Maxwell theory, showing that a class of four-dimensional charged fluid space-times exists, satisfying conditions that include isometric fluid motion, the dual of the electromagnetic field tensor having no projection in the direction of a Killing vector, and a constant ratio of charge to mass. A spherically symmetric solution is obtained using hypergeometric functions.
